By the way, do NFT locks exist yet? Otherwise let‚Äôs build it üò≥

Probably there‚Äôs people who know better but here‚Äôs what I‚Äôm thinking 

**hardware:**
+ Bluetooth lock (any of the many that accept commands)
+ local Raspberry pi server

Software:
+ user facing mobile web app hosted on pi
+ connect wallet feature (sign)
+ scan QR to unlock (would link to the local server domain via WiFi ) 

Something like that.

Main thing is getting those Bluetooth locks.

BTW everyone here is my recording checklist I made after using Francis's microphone's last night: 

Recording Checklist 

- [ ] Did you do a test recording?
- [ ] Are all the connections secure?
- [ ] Are the tripods at the correct height?
- [ ] Is there dead space in the frame? 
- [ ] Is the framerate and format correct?
- [ ] Does the microphone need a dead mouse? 
- [ ] Did you press the button to record each microphone individually? Is the light red?
- [ ] Is audio signal coming through?
- [ ] Did you do a test recording?

yes this is why I bought a rice cooker and organic brown rice to add to my Blueprint meals. I just use simple cup measures, not scales, because my brain is busy with too many other numbers.... But others learning about their nutritional needs will need to be more granular.

@undefined  would be nice to have discussions on blue print approach & sport and educate people on how to optimize their performance with this nutrition‚Ä¶

Hi food gang, I‚Äôm a bit behind lots of initiatives and like to focus more on community tooling vs. basic nutrition (unless it‚Äôs for the high performance stuff like the marathon runners). 

I think there is a need to instruct and educate more on nutrition during onboarding. I see movement now with using the kitchen scales like Rob did or measuring biomarkers. Not all members have knowledge why this all matters though. So potentially it may make sense to push content through ChatGPT using the daily Menues to educate about the ingredients which have impact for macro tracking. 

It would also help to communicate the healthy food focus or include portion sizing suggestions.

2. Reset Network Settings (iPhone):
Go to Settings > General > Reset > Reset Network Settings. This will remove all saved Wi-Fi networks, so they‚Äôll have to reconnect to each one afterward.

3. Update Devices:
Ensure the latest software updates are installed on both the Mac and iPhone.

Thoughts after meeting:
- NS food prioritises quality and  nutrition.
- Catering to all tastes and preferences is too hard, so keep recipes simple with seasonings and sauces on the side.
- Needs to be manageable, minimise wastage 
- Meat, particularly fish, is costly. 
- People keen to track macros.
- Some people eat less expensive (carbs, plant based) food, and less calories (women, older people)
- For these reasons, a weekly plan may not work well (I wouldn't pay for it)
- Suggest 'pay per meal unit' with higher prices for meat meals
- Would a meal voucher system work? I.e. standard meal plus plant protein or plus meat ? 
- A rice cooker with brown rice & quinoa for everyone to fill their plates from, to satisfy calorie needs
